name: Montenegro
description: Montenegro, often referred to as the 'Black Mountain' due to its dramatic karst landscapes and dense forests, is a small Balkan nation situated on the Adriatic Sea. It boasts a stunning coastline, towering mountains, and a rich cultural heritage shaped by its diverse history.  The country offers a unique blend of adventure, relaxation, and cultural experiences, making it a popular destination for travelers seeking natural beauty and authentic experiences.

quickFacts.label: Capital
quickFacts.description: The bustling capital city of Montenegro.
quickFacts.detail: Podgorica is a modern city with a growing economy and a vibrant cultural scene.

quickFacts.label: Area
quickFacts.description: A relatively small but incredibly diverse country.
quickFacts.detail: Montenegro's terrain is characterized by rugged mountains, coastal plains, and numerous rivers and lakes.

quickFacts.label: Population
quickFacts.detail: The majority of the population speaks Montenegrin, Serbian, Croatian, and Albanian.

quickFacts.label: Currency
quickFacts.detail: The Euro is the official currency of Montenegro.

quickFacts.label: Official Language
quickFacts.description: A Slavic language with influences from other Balkan languages.
quickFacts.detail: Serbian and Croatian are also widely spoken.

climateData.title: Montenegrin Climate
climateData.description: Montenegro experiences a Mediterranean climate with significant seasonal variations. The coast enjoys warm, sunny summers, while the mountains experience cooler temperatures and snowfall in winter.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Summer (June - August)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Warm and sunny days with average temperatures between 25°C and 30°C (77°F - 86°F) along the coast. Inland, temperatures can be hotter, reaching 35°C (95°F).

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Autumn (September - November)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Pleasant temperatures, with average highs ranging from 18°C to 22°C (64°F - 72°F). The landscape transforms into vibrant autumnal colors.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Winter (December - February)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Cold and snowy in the mountains, with average temperatures between 0°C and 5°C (32°F - 41°F). The coast remains relatively mild, with occasional rainfall.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Spring (March - May)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Mild temperatures, with average highs ranging from 10°C to 18°C (50°F - 64°F). Wildflowers bloom across the landscape.

naturalWonders.name: Durmitor National Park
naturalWonders.description: Durmitor National Park is a UNESCO World Heritage Site renowned for its dramatic peaks, glacial lakes, and pristine forests. It’s a haven for biodiversity and offers incredible opportunities for hiking and adventure.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The park’s centerpiece is Black Lake (Crno Jezero), a stunning glacial lake formed by a moraine dam. The Tara River Canyon, one of the deepest in the world, also flows through the park.
viewingTips: Check weather conditions before heading out.

naturalWonders.name: Bay of Kotor
naturalWonders.description: The Bay of Kotor, also known as Boka Kotorska, is a stunning fjord-like bay surrounded by towering mountains. Its historic towns and picturesque villages make it a captivating destination.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The bay is a UNESCO World Heritage Site and boasts a rich maritime history. The town of Kotor, with its medieval walls and churches, is a highlight.
viewingTips: Take a boat trip to explore the bay.

naturalWonders.name: Sutjeska National Park
naturalWonders.description: Sutjeska National Park is known for its stunning Vrtić Lake, the largest mountain lake in Montenegro, and its rich biodiversity.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The park is home to the Drina River Canyon, one of the deepest in Europe. It’s a popular destination for hiking, rafting, and wildlife viewing.

biodiversityCategory.name: Mediterranean Flora
biodiversityCategory.description: Montenegro’s Mediterranean climate supports a diverse range of flora, including olive trees, pine forests, and endemic species.

statistics.details: Olive cultivation is a significant part of the country’s agricultural heritage.
Various pine species contribute to the landscape and provide habitat for wildlife.

notableSpecies.name: Montenegrin Pine (Pinus mugo)
notableSpecies.significance: A unique pine species found only in Montenegro.

notableSpecies.name: Mediterranean Lentil (Lens culinaris)
notableSpecies.significance: An important crop for the region's economy.

ecosystemData.title: Montenegrin Ecosystems
ecosystemData.overview: Montenegro’s diverse landscapes support a range of ecosystems, including Mediterranean forests, alpine meadows, and coastal wetlands.

biodiversityCategories.name: Coastal Wetlands
biodiversityCategories.description: Montenegro’s coastline is dotted with wetlands, providing habitat for numerous bird species and supporting important fish nurseries.

statistics.details: A major migratory route for birds.

notableSpecies.name: Flamingo
notableSpecies.significance: A spectacular sight during the migration season.

activities.title: Outdoor Activities in Montenegro
activities.description: Montenegro offers a wide range of outdoor activities for all skill levels, from hiking and cycling to water sports and adventure tourism.

activityCategories.name: Hiking
activityCategories.description: Explore Montenegro’s stunning mountains and trails.

activities.name: Durmitor Summit Hike
activities.description: A challenging hike to the summit of Bobotov Kuk, Montenegro’s highest peak.
activities.requirements: Good physical fitness, hiking boots, appropriate clothing.

activities.name: Coastal Trail Hike
activities.description: Enjoy a scenic hike along the Montenegrin coastline.

activityCategories.name: Water Sports
activityCategories.description: Enjoy the crystal-clear waters of the Adriatic Sea.

activities.name: Kayaking
activities.description: Explore the coastline and hidden coves by kayak.

activities.name: Scuba Diving
activities.description: Discover the underwater world of Montenegro.
